details:
Several remote vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Mantis bug
tracking system, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary web script.
The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures project identifies the following
problems:


* [CVE-2006-0664](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2006-0664)
A cross-site scripting vulnerability was discovered in
 config\_defaults\_inc.php.
* [CVE-2006-0665](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2006-0665)
Cross-site scripting vulnerabilities were discovered in query\_store.php
 and manage\_proj\_create.php.
* [CVE-2006-0841](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2006-0841)
Multiple cross-site scripting vulnerabilities were discovered in
 view\_all\_set.php, manage\_user\_page.php, view\_filters\_page.php and
 proj\_doc\_delete.php.
* [CVE-2006-1577](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2006-1577)
Multiple cross-site scripting vulnerabilities were discovered in
 view\_all\_set.php.


For the stable distribution (sarge) these problems have been fixed in
version 0.19.2-5sarge4.1.


For the unstable distribution (sid) these problems have been fixed in
version 0.19.4-3.1.


We recommend that you upgrade your mantis package.
